revised_title: Diffraction: Theories and Discoveries of Grimaldi, Fabri, Hooke, and Newton
tldr: This article explores the history of diffraction, focusing on the discoveries and theories of Francesco Maria Grimaldi, Honore Fabri, Robert Hooke, and Isaac Newton. It discusses how their experiments and ideas contributed to the understanding of diffraction and its impact on the field of optics during the 17th century.
